Fecal Impaction – Causes and Treatment Options

Fecal impaction is the mass of solid stool or fecal material that trapped in the rectum. This hard stool is located between bowels and rectum of human body indicates obstruction. The obstruction results in spasm, pain and bloating.

Causes of Fecal Impaction:

There may be many causes of fecal impaction. Some main causes of fecal impaction are following-

Constipation- constipation is one of the prime causes of fecal impaction. If some one is ignoring constipation or suffering from constipation from a long time then he or she may face fecal impaction.

Excess use of Pain Medicines- Excess use of pain medicines may also be causes of fecal impaction.

Long-Term Use of Laxatives – Long term use of laxatives medicines is also one of the causes of fecal impaction.

Nutritional Causes- Some foods having fat, cholesterol, low fiber and sugar, may be causes of fecal impaction.

Drinking Inadequate Water – Drinking inadequate water is one of the prime causes of fecal impaction.

Symptoms of Fecal Impaction:

The symptoms of fecal impaction are similar to constipation symptoms. Also you may have bladder problems, back pain, vomiting problems, fever, dizziness, and blood pressure problems if you are suffering from fecal impaction. Individuals may also face diarrhea but it doesn’t remove the fecal impaction. Generally individual who face fecal impaction take too much time in toilet.

Fecal Impaction Treatment:

Change your Eating Habits:- Foods having high fat, low fiber, cholesterol, sugar, and spices etc. may be causes of fecal impaction. Also importance of red meats over vegetables in diet may be causes of fecal impaction. Doctors advise that one must increase high fiber foods, vegetable and easy digestive foods in daily diet schedule to avoid and treat fecal impaction. Avoid eating in hurry and eat foods with spending enough time in chewing so that it can be digest easily in your stomach.

Drink Adequate Water- If you drink inadequate water then there may be chance to face fecal impaction. Doctors advise that you must drink sufficient water daily for producing healthy stools and helping to flush them from body.

Review Dietary Supplements and Pain Medicines – You should review your dietary supplements and pain medicines. Iron pills increase the hardness of stools and may be causes of constipation. Also some pain medicines may be causes of constipation which may be convert into fecal impaction.

Know about common symptoms of cancer and treatment options

Cancer is associated with several meanings that it has become complex for an average person to know about it from objective standpoint. After hearing a cancer diagnosis, sufferer perceives it as a death sentence, and visualizes the inflexibilities of chemotherapy, and contemplates the end of his or her life. These similar thoughts have firmly rooted in most societies, making definition of cancer challenging. Cancer takes the life of one, out of every four people, which is second to heart disease.

What is cancer?

“Cancer” cannot be considered as a one single disease. It is in fact a complex disease having variations galore. Cancer also causes death and is described as a locally invasive and incontrollable cell growth pattern, which is due to problems and damages taking place in the genes of the cells. The type of cancer is named on the originated organ or tissue system. Cancer is caused due to unregulated growth of these abnormal cells. The cells keep on dividing and multiplying forming cancerous tumors.

What is cancer ? This question is now easy to define as over the past decade, the amount of effort and resources devoted to cancer research has increased. With the new research, experts have achieved incredible results exposing many about this lethal disease. Besides, people have now become aware of cancer as a serious malice affecting anyone. Cancer is not exception to anyone for instance chronic smokers to the most innocent victims or babies born with cancer.

A wide spectrum of non-specific cancer symptoms includes:

•Persistent Fatigue: This is most common symptom of weight loss.

•Untargeted Weight Loss

•Pain: Pain spreading to bone can be a symptom of cancer.

•Fever: Fever causing impact on immune system can make person to several cancers.

•Bowel Changes: This is the most common symptom of colon cancer.

•Chronic cough: This can be a symptom lung cancer.
Cancer Treatments

There are five major types of cancer treatment and are described below:

1.Surgery: This one engages operation to remove the tumour.

2.Radiotherapy – In radiotherapy high energy x-rays break the cancer cells causing very little harm to normal cells.

3.Active surveillance – There are certain cancer that slowly grow in and are not that harmful. But doctor will monitor to halt the growth at that very time when it starts to bud.

4.Hormonal therapy – In this treatment the levels of hormones are altered or blocked.

5.Chemotherapy – This involves the usage of anti-cancer drugs used for ruining cancer cells.

Gastric disorders - Causes and Treatments

Gas problem generally results from infection with same bacterium, traumatic injuries or regular use of pain relievers may cause stomach ulcers. Suffer may feel traumatic inflammation in lining of stomach which can be way too overwhelming and damaging.

Few causes of gastric problem are as mention below:

•Bacterial Infection: It is primarily caused due to bacteria called as helicobacter pylori (H. pylori). It stays in mucous area, which later coats the lining of your stomach. Reasons are still unrevealed but primary it is caused due to contaminated food and water.

•Frequent use of Pain Relievers: Regular intake of no steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as aspirin, ibuprofen and naproxen can lead to stomach inflammation.

•Cocaine: Its regular intake can be injurious, which may even lead to serious bleeding or gastric issues.

Few chronic gastric problem symptoms are as mention:

•Nausea
•Vomiting
•Loss of appetite
•Belching or bloating
•Weight loss
•Feeling of fullness in upper abdominal area even before eating

Gastritis which occurs abruptly normally results in combination of nausea and burning pain or discomfort in upper abdomen. In rare cases it may even lead to bleeding unless there’s ulceration of stomach lining. Bleeding from stomach may cause other digestive health disorders and may even cause vomit blood, pass black, tarry stools or even serious medical attention.

Other gastric symptoms include:

•Gastroenteritis
•Heartburn
•Stomach ulcers
•Nonnuclear dyspepsia

Here are few gastric problem treatments as mention:

•In case of frequent indigestion eat small and frequent meals to fill the stomach acid secretion. Avoid intake of spicy, acidic, fried or fatty food content.

•Avoid excessive intake of alcohol as it can irritate and erode mucous lining of your stomach, which may resultant inflammation and bleeding.

•Avoid smoking as it increases stomach acid, delays stomach healing and is a leading risk factor for stomach cancer. Reduce the amount of smoking.

•Most of the treatments include taking few beneficial drugs to reduce stomach acid.

Antibiotic help destroy bacteria and thus blocks or proton pump inhibitor relieves pain and nausea, heals inflammation and may increase the antibiotic's effectiveness. Take effective medication and expert supervision to get rid of problem from root causes.

Know about nail affecting disease - Onycholysis

Is your toenail coming out from the nail bed? Then you might be Onycholysis. It is disorder that affecting nails. This condition is recognized by splitting of the nail bed, of the finger or the toe, from the nail plate. Usually, the nail plate remains associated to the nail bed. In this condition, the nail loosens itself and it starts coming out from the nail bed. The nail resembles like that of half-moon and the end starts rising like a hood.

This nail disease affects people of any age group and gender but it is more common in adults and specifically females. This one is highly common in women than in men. There are several cases of Onycholysis in children can be observed. This can be tagged by the name “Brittle Nails”.

Causes of Onycholysis

A number of factors can lead to Onycholysis. Some of them are discussed below:

1.Improper manicuring of the nails and over-trimming of the nails can lead to this disease.

2.Wearing tight-fitted shoes lead to sweating making toenails under stress for a long time.

3.Over secretion of the thyroid glands is cause of onycholysis.

4.Deficiency of iron in the body gives rise to this disease.

5.Skin problems like eczema and psoriasis can also act as factors. In these cases, skin around the nail and cuticle turns dry and flaky.

6.Exposure of the skin to an irritating substance gives rise to the nail problems. There are certain chemicals in nail polish causing allergy on the skin and generating harsh symptoms separating nail from the skin.

7.The nail disease can occur due to long exposure to water.

8.Side-effect of certain medications. Tiny and white marks may be noticed on the nail as a result.

9.Psoriasis is a main cause of nail disease. This one is a chronic skin disorder. When it affects skin of the fingers and toes, then one can witness serious affects on nails. At later stages, the entire nail is removed from the bed. Onycholysis in psoriatic fingernails is difficult to treat.

Onycholysis treatment is simple and demands attention towards nail. One should pay attention while clipping off the portion of the nail. The nail that has separated itself can't be reattached you have to wait for the nail to grow. Trimming and keeping the nail short is vital self treatment. Long nails are more susceptible to injuries. Besides, one should not also expose nails to the harsh chemicals leading to skin irritation. Avoiding long contact with moisture is also effective measure.

Pernicious Anemia – Symptoms and Treatment Options

Pernicious anemia is a critical condition that occurs when body stops absorbing enough vitamin B12, which is of great importance to our body. In particular cells that line up stomach lose their ability to produce enough substance named Intrinsic Factor, which causes this critical condition. To matter of fact intrinsic factor is important as it is an ideal combination of vitamin B12 to form B12 intrinsic factor so that digestive system can absorb it. Vitamin B12 is also well known as cobalamin, which plays vital role in several processes in human body. So if you are going through any such agony, it may be among worst blood disorder to take proper care of.

Vitamin B12 helps produce red blood cells, supports nerve cell function and even helps build DNA. In case body’s immune system malfunctions and begins attacking cells in stomach, it leads to decrease in intrinsic factor, which greatly affects B12 absorption for worst. To be precise pernicious anemia is also known as megaloblastic anemia, it describes large and immature red blood cell seen in people with same condition.

Here are few pernicious anemia symptoms as mention:

•Weakness Fatigue Numbness
•tingling of hands and feet
•Difficulty walking
•Decreased appetite
•Weight loss
•Nausea
•Tender, smooth tongue
•Diarrhea
•Irritability
•Increased heart rate

Generally an abnormality in red blood cells gets normal by supplementing vitamin B12. In case pernicious anemia is detected in later stages it may cause nerve damage, numbness and tingling, which can be permanent. Usually it can be detected through routine checkups and a blood test (CBC, or cell blood count). People who are at extreme of developing the risk are elderly, strict vegetarians who don't take diet rich in vitamin B12 and pregnant women.
Importantly babies been breast feed by vegetarian moms are at higher risk of developing vitamin B12 deficiency by age 4 to 6 months. Their liver reserves are normally plentiful and if gets limited can be quickly depicted quickly and can adverse growth rate.

Remember, folate supplement is also recommended along with vitamin B12. If taken alone my indeed alleviate the anemia but allow the neurologic (nerve) deficits to progress or even accelerate. For this reason it’s imperative to take both the supplements together. This treatment generally corrects your anemic condition and if started in the early stages can also correct any neurological disorders. Problem of deficiency caused due to poor diet will require a change in diet options.

Myths and Facts about Maintaining Ideal Body Weight

Are you able to sustain an ideal weight for height as irony of reducing or maintaining it is surely a pain. But the main question that arises is how to effectively do it for your own good? Since, there are thousands of reliable weight reduction reports and programs advertized daily can be a trustworthy source for you. Behind all reduction theories and amongst all confusion creep a lot of myths, misconceptions and scams. Here are few common weight reduction myths and facts which can set you on healthy track to reduce and maintain your ideal weight are as below:

Myth: Reducing weight faster encourages people to stay on the plan.

Fact: At one time reducing weight may seem easy and encouraging for people to stay on the plan however only in the short term. Truth is when you starve yourself you lose muscles and this slows your metabolism. Thus body burns fewer calories and will become more difficult to reduce and maintain weight in long term.

Myth: Eating only three meals per day and avoiding snacks is best way to reduce weight.

Fact: Eating three main meals with wholesome healthy low-calorie snack in morning and mid afternoon is highly effective. Snacking within your regular calorie count avoids deprivation. The low-calorie snacks need to be counted as the total daily calorie in-take. For example: 1,400 calories. Breakfast: 350 calories. Mid-morning snack: 100 calories. Lunch: 400 (450) calories. Mid-afternoon snack: 100 calories. Dinner: 450 (400) calories.

Myth: Low-fat food plans are the best to avoid extra intake of calories.

Fact: This myth may seem to be true in few cases and false too. The truth is twofold.

• Body needs certain amount of fat to function properly.
• Low-fat or fat free foods are still high in calories, fillers, and sugar.

Ultimately the amount of calories one consumes is what leads to weight gain and not the amount of fat consumed. An ideal weight for height can be maintained with an effective food plan with no saturated or Trans fat but rich in MUFA. Research reveals foods rich in MUFA helps improve blood cholesterol, which reduces heart disease. Most popular MUFA foods include: Raw Almonds, Walnuts, Macadamia, Cashew, Pine nuts, Sunflower seeds, Pumpkin seeds, Avocado, No hydrogenated peanut or almond butter spreads,.Include PUFA rich diet found in plant-based food and oils which are essential for a healthy food plan. PUFA improves blood cholesterol and also reduces risk of type 2 diabetes. Increase your intake of fruits and vegetables in your daily food plan, and exercise regularly. Create a healthy lifestyle and maintain your ideal weight according to your blood type.

Sign – Symptoms and Prevention of Pernicious Anemia

There are several blood diseases that are known for affecting human health can also ruin nerves and other organs if it persists for long time and can develop stomach cancer is pernicious anemia. It is a disease where large, immature, nucleated cells mobilize in the blood, and do not function as blood cells. This disease is caused by deficiency of vitamin B-12 and lack of intrinsic factor (IF) in the gastric mucosa. Anemia is caused due disruptions in the generation of red blood cells or hemoglobin as well due to enhanced spoiling of red blood cells or loss of blood.

This blood diseases is mainly due to an unfitness to absorb vitamin B-12 from the gastrointestinal tract. Our source of vitamin B-12 is animal products; both meat and dairy products provide us dietary sources of vitamin B-12. The body can save vitamin B-12 for a long time, so lack of dietary consumption need to continue for years before a true deficiency of vitamin B-12 is reached. This is the reason that pernicious anemia symptoms do not appear for years. While this type of anemia is most commonly determined in adults with an average age of 60 and a rare congenital type of pernicious anemia has been described.

Pernicious anemia symptoms

As with other causes of anemia, symptoms associated to decreased oxygen-carrying capacity of the blood and also include tiredness and shortness of breath. Vitamin B-12 deficiency also lends hindrance with the function of the nervous system and symptoms due to nervous system damages.

Pernicious anemia symptoms are as follows:

Feeling tired and weak
Tingling and numbness in hands and feet
A bright red, smooth tongue

Prevention of pernicious anemia

The anemia caused due to autoimmune process cannot be prevented. Vitamin B-12 deficiency mainly due to gastrointestinal diseases and gastrointestinal surgery can be treated to the certain extent. Vitamin B-12 is extracted mainly from animal sources, which are meat, fish, poultry and milk. Deficiency of this vitamin in vegetarians can be removed by the use of oral vitamin B-12 supplements. An oral dose of 100-200 micrograms (mcg) taken weekly is sufficient.

Pregnant and nursing women being vegetarians or vegan must consume B-12 supplement and must inform their doctors they are vegetarians or vegans. Besides, one can get rid of this blood disease by consuming foods that are high in vitamin B12 and folic acid, thus helping in prevention of vitamin B12 deficiency, which is caused by a poor diet.

Treat swollen feet with home remedies

Common Types of Allergies and its Treatments

Nonetheless this sensitivity may even lead to violent reactions in human body. To be precise allergy means elimination of unbefitting substances by the body system. There are enormous forms of allergies from chronic ones to nasal, if these are not treated properly can lead to many other problems for sufferer. Term nasal allergy is the occurrence of chronic allergy within cells of nose lining.

In other forms chronic allergies are comparatively more serious in nature than nasal ones. Sufferer may even develop nasal allergies and can also be get affected by non-allergic stimuli. Any random cold air or dry air particle present in atmosphere are few examples of non-allergic stimuli. Prevention from any type of allergy is imperative in any odd case and thus adopting preventive measures from substances that can lead to allergy is crucial.

Here are few common allergens:

•Dust mites
•Animal dander
•Mold spores

An introduction to types and symptoms of diabetes

Surviving with a chronic condition such as diabetes is highly complicated and stressful. Making oneself aware about everything that is needed to care for your diabetes will be helpful in managing your health better and also lowers stress. You can also get prepared in case of diabetes emergencies.

What is diabetes?

Diabetes mellitus can be said as related diseases in which the body is unable to regulate the amount of sugar (especially glucose) in the blood. The blood offers glucose to lend the body with energy to carry day to day activities.

Here look at some points explaining what is diabetes?

• The liver transforms the food into glucose, which is then released into the bloodstream.

• In a healthy person, several hormones manage the blood glucose level, primarily insulin. Insulin is generated by the pancreas. It is a small organ located between the stomach and liver. The pancreas is responsible for making vital enzymes that is released into the gut aids in digestion of food.

• Insulin lets glucose to push from the blood into cells throughout the body, which then can be used as a fuel.

• Diabetics either are not able to generate enough insulin or unable to use insulin properly, or both.

• In diabetes, glucose in the blood unable to efficiently into cells. So, blood glucose levels remain high. This not only starves all the cells that need the glucose for fuel, but also harms certain organs and tissues exposed to the high glucose levels.

Diabetes is classified in following types:

• Type 1 Diabetes

Previously recognized as juvenile diabetes; Type 1 diabetes has effects on body’s immune system and the immune system ruins insulin generating cells in the pancreas.

• Type 2 Diabetes

Type 2 diabetes is the most common type of diabetes found in people with diabetes. It is observed more in children.

• Pre-diabetes and Insulin Resistance

This type of diabetes increases the risk of heart disease.

• Gestational Diabetes

Gestational diabetes occurs during pregnancy.

Leukemia - Symptoms and Treatment options

Youngsters have to bud strongly, as they are the future and lay strong path for nation. They are so keen to fulfill their vivacious aspirations and dreams that not even cancer can halt their trip destined to achieve their goals. Yes, Leukemia is a cancer that might target the youngsters but good understanding of it can help in overcoming.

What is Leukemia?

Leukemia is cancer of the blood cells. It begins in the bone marrow, which is a soft tissue inside most bones. Blood cells originate in bone marrow.

In healthy person, bone marrow generates:

• White blood cells -Help combating body infection.
• Red blood cells- Carry oxygen to all parts of the body.
• Platelets- Help blood clot.

However, person with leukemia make bone marrow to produce several abnormal white blood cells, called leukemia cells. They do not work as that of normal white blood cells and also bud at faster rate than normal cells. Even breakage in their budding does not occur, which is really mandatory.

Rapidly growing leukemia cells dominate the normal blood cells, which is an invitation to serious problems such as blood diseases, bleeding, and infections. Leukemia cells disseminate to the lymph nodes or other organs and lead to swelling or pain.

Types of leukemia

There are several different types of leukemia. In general, leukemia is classified on its nature of getting worse and what kind of white blood cell does it affects.

• Acute or chronic leukemia: This one spreads fast and person easily falls sick.
• Lymphocytic or myelogenous. Both affect white blood cells.

Adults are known from suffering chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and acute myelogenous leukemia. However, in children, leukemia is acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). Childhood leukemias might also incorporate acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) and other myeloid leukemias, including chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) and juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML).

Symptoms of Leukemia

As you are now aware about this cancer, you should also learn about common Leukemia symptoms :

• Fever and night sweats.
• Headaches.
• Bruising or bleeding
• Pain in bone or joint
• Swollen or ache in belly from an enlarged spleen.
• Swollen lymph nodes in the armpit, neck, or groin.
• Getting a lot of infections.
• Fatigue or weakness.
• Loss in weight and also appetite

Leukemia treatment is helpful in curing this disease. Following are some treatments for leukemia.

1.In chemotherapy powerful medicines are used to kill cancer cells.

2.Radiation therapy uses high-dose X-rays to ruin cancer cells and shrink swollen lymph nodes or an enlarged spleen.

3.Stem cell transplant helps in rebuilding supply of normal blood cells, as they are destroyed in radiation or chemotherapy.

4.Biological therapy makes use of special medicines that improve body's natural defenses against cancer.
